citation.article-title: Characteristics of Sulfobacillus acidophilus sp. nov. and other moderately thermophilic mineral-sulphide-oxidizing bacteria.

p.s: Description of Sulfobacillus acidophilus sp. nov.
Sullfobacillus acidophilus (a.ci.do'phi.lus, ML n. acidum an acid; Gr. adj. philus loving; ML adj. acidophilus acid-loving)
Gram-positive rods (0.5-0.8 x 3.0-5.0 μm) with spherical endospores.
Optimum growth is at 45-50 °C and approximately pH 2.
Autotrophic growth occurs with ferrous iron and elemental sulphur as substrates.
Growth on ferrous iron can also be mixotrophic with simultaneous utilization of glucose and CO2.
Heterotrophic growth occurs with yeast extract as substrate.
Chromosomal DNA base composition is between 55 and 57 mol% G + C.
Source: various acidic environments rich in iron, sulphur or mineral sulphides.
Type strain: strain NAL (German Collection of Micro-organisms, DSM 10332).
